review.reviewBody: Great jacket, comfortable and packable, nice pockets. Only caution is that it runs small to size. I can fit in it but it is very snug. I'm not sure it can handle a big sweater underneath. The lavender color is slightly metallic looking (shiny), I didn't expect that.
review.name: Helium down jacket

review.reviewBody: OR Designers went above and beyond with this jacket. The color is an obvious wow, but that just scratches the surface. + a little longer than your normal puffy gives added warmth for those cold days on the slopes or climbing in the mountains + soft lined pockets (all of them) invite you to warm your hands in there and feel safe putting your goggles, sunglases or clear glasses in with no fear of scratching + a high collar (with a soft chin liner) gives added warmth without using a separate neck gaiter. When replacing your down jacket, THIS is your only and best choice!
review.name: So many + elements to this jacket!

review.reviewBody: The designers went way above expectation with this jacket. Elements like soft fleece lined pockets, an extra high collar which acts like a neck gaiter, and an ultra-light weight jacket that provide unmatched warmth, this jacket exceeds all your needs. No question, add this jacket to your kit!
review.name: So many + elements to this jacket

review.reviewBody: The perfect jacket for wearing alone or layering under a shell. Packs up small if you need to stash it in a backpack. Five stars!
review.name: Warm and compressible!

review.reviewBody: I wear this jacket daily and especially on this International Women's day I tip my hat to all the women of the mountains, united by our love of skiing. The friendships formed and connections forged are stories worth celebrating in style.
review.name: International Woman

review.reviewBody: This jacket is exactly what I hoped for. Because I run and hike in Northern California winter weather I needed something breathable, warm, and flexible. This jacket is so light and comfortable it feels like a second skin. Thank you OR!
review.name: Second skin

review.reviewBody: 800 fill packs a lot of punch in warm, lightweight down performance jacket with useful features like multiple pockets and hem cinch cord. Less bulky looking than other down jackets. Small fit worked well for 5'2" petite woman, though sleeves a bit long. Lake color beautiful. Purchased as gift and now considering one for myself!
review.name: Great combo of Fit, Form, Function

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this for camping so I wanted the reinforced shoulders, compactibility and hopefully durability.
review.name: I like the softness and length.

review.reviewBody: I took this jacket backpacking in WV where the low at night was 10 degrees. Along with a few other Outdoor Research layers, it kept me warm at camp and while I was sleeping. I kept it on while hiking the next morning and when it warmed up I took it off. I was surprised at how cool I felt after taking it off. Also love how it packs into its own pocket. I highly recommend!
review.name: Warm and Light

review.reviewBody: Got this and took it on a 40 mile section hike and it was great. It is lightweight. When I got hot it stuffed well in the front of my pack.
review.name: Perfect light but warm

review.reviewBody: When I moved recently , I thought I had lost my sportivas. Found these on sale and snapped them up. I like the color and the fit better than the other ones. I ended up finding my old ones. Think I’ll wear these instead.
review.name: Just right!

review.reviewBody: I ordered these online initially in my usual shoe size (Euro 42), but when I received them, found that they were huge on my feet! I had about 1-1.5" of extra space between my toes and the end of the shoe. I went to try on the shoes in person so I could exchange them for the correct size. I ended up exchanging for a pair that were 2.5 sizes lower than my usual shoe size (Euro 39.5). If you're able to try these on in person before buying, do it! I was also told by an associate that they have a tendency to loosen up and stretch to about a half size larger with use. They seem like great shoes so far now that I have the correct size!
review.name: Run large!!

review.reviewBody: Note* I did not use these to climb in. I wanted to leave a review to help those looking for the right size when ordering. I consistently wear a size 8 in women's and ordered a 8.5. So order a half a size up. They fit fine but the heel area hugged my heel a little too much and sat a little higher than other shoes I tried. I know if I kept them they would have likely rubbed my heels and left them blistered.
review.name: Runs Small

review.reviewBody:
Just got back from a ride in this helmet and realized I hadn’t dropped a review yet! I’ve spent several months with this thing, and it’s the one on my head the most over the other options I’ve got in the garage. In short, it’s excellent. There’s nothing I would change. The fit system, while not a licensed BOA design, is a well executed one that I’ve had zero issues with, and is easy to adjust on the fly when I’ve realized it isn’t tight enough and my glasses start smacking off the underside of the brim. I LOVE the aero magnetic clippy vent covers, not so much for the aero benefits, but because this makes it a true year-round helmet! I actually started my ride in the cold today, and as it (and I) warmed up, I simply just reached up and popped the covers off and stuffed them in a pocket. Super easy, so adaptable. I have a 59cm circumference head right on the dot and I just barely sneak into a medium comfortably. I only snug down the ratchet a few clicks, which is how I like my helmets to fit. I still have room for a super thin cycling cap or balaclava. However, consider sizing up if you’re borderline. The fit is probably the most oval-shaped I’ve worn. I have what I would consider a normal ovalish, roundish head, and this one fits the longest and narrowest compared to my POC, Bell, Lazer, Giro, and Smith helmets. I wear a medium in all of these brands. Glasses storage is flawless, some of the best I’ve ever had in a helmet. If you’re interested in this helmet, reach out to your friendly neighborhood Gearhead and let’s get you rolling!

#CompetitiveCyclistGearheads #BackcountryGearheads
review.name: Dialed!

review.reviewBody:
The aesthetics initially piqued my curiosity about this helmet, but the features and functionality of this helmet are fantastic. Great for early spring riding when temperatures are still chilly and removing the vents to get some airflow as the temperatures rise makes for comfortable riding—the opportunity to be a bit more aero when riding is fun, too. I purchased the Nani colorway and the finish has some nice design details. 

I've loved riding in this and look forward to continuing to do so.
review.name: Form and function working in synergy

review.reviewBody: I really like the helmet for the features like removable air panels, fidlock magnetic strap, aero design......but it ends there. Let me explain. From day one after buying this helmet which let me say I did plenty of homework on my next aero helmet and it came down to this one and the Rudy Nytron with the Ekoi AR14 close behind. I went with the Sweet Protection LE version for color visibility. Was impressed by look and feel upon arrival but immediately noticed the rear occigrip did not tighten and hold, rather as soon as you dialed it in and let go of the dial wheel it slipped every time! Not good! So eventually contacted the manufacturer and fairly prompt response and they stated they would ship me a new occigrip system to replace the defective one. Has never arrived! Followup took days for response and their only defense ismit comes from overseas!  I get packages in about a week from even China!  Not acceptable in my book as it is safety related. I will be replacing this helmet and scorching their CS whenever I can as they either did not send it or have yet to! Doesn't matter......should have been state-side easily in a month. Buyer beware if you get a defective unit as to warranty being used!
review.name: Nice design & features but.......

review.reviewBody: Really impressed with the Sweet Protection helmets. I have a Bushwhacker for MTB, and I got this Falconer 2Vi for my gravel/road riding. Fit is great, arguable one of the best looking helmets in my opinion, and it breathes incredibly well. Best part is the aero covers. I find myself wearing it with them off primarily, but as the weather gets cold, I like being able to reduce some of the airflow to keep my head a little toastier. Highly recommend this helmet.
review.name: Do it All Road Helmet

name: Falconer Aero 2Vi Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: Perfect pole. Extends and retracts easily. Stays were I adjusted them
review.name: Great pole. Extra strong. Good design

review.reviewBody: I bougth these before Christmas and haven’t tried them yet. But today when putting on the basket I noticed to my dismay that they didn’t have the articulated basket. So disappointed. I had done so much research to find the perfect pole, and somehow I must have missed that this version of Salomon mtn s3 did not have the articulated basket. Too late for return, so sad.
review.name: Where is the articulated basket?

review.reviewBody: Amazing poles that incorporate so much of the nuance that a good touring poles requires! Light swing weight, adjustable for poling on flats, ergonomic hand grips, long section of ribbed eva form that is good thickness for gripping down on uphill side, breakaway straps if you get slid. ONLY suggestion for next version is a truly articulating basket around a ball (see the black crows version) that automatically adjusts to whatever slope angle you're on. THAT would be the perfect pole!
review.name: Rad Poles!

review.reviewBody: Impressed with the MTN Carbon overall but fastener connecting the pole pieces slips.
review.name: Well designed
comment:
Hi there,
 
We have received your feedback and would like to thank you for taking the time to write to us about your Salomon MTN CARBON S3. The most valuable information we can receive from customers is feedback about how our products are performing in the field. 

We often make adjustments to our products based on direct customer feedback. We'll make sure to pass your feedback this along to our Designers. 

 If you have any further questions, please feel free to contact our Customer Service Department on Tel : +18332300292 (7-17 MDT, Mon - Fri)

review.reviewBody:
I broke my poles during my last trip and bought these poles at Telluride, just for the look! They turned out to be the best poles I have ever owned. Auto release straps means I don't need to teke the straps off in the trees. Very balanced weight and the rotating basket is actually a genius idea. I am so happy with them!
Cons:
-I don't like the pink print, so I will probably paint over it.
-there is a a very thin/narrow and kinda flimsy part connects the strap to the pole. It's already showing signs of wear and tear after 5 days of skiing. I can't see it last for long so I hope Salomon provides replacement straps in the future once needed.
review.name: Amazing poles!

review.reviewBody: These poles are the best backcountry that I’ve ever used. Stiff, light and great strap & grip. Adjustable poles are tuff to stay locked. These once locked (with their very innovative locking system) never move which is a relief. If you ever been skiing and confronted an adjustable pole that won’t stay locked you know how frustrating it can be. Great poles with no improvements needed!
review.name: The bees knees

review.reviewBody: Not sure why all these people think these things aren't durable.  I've beat mine up for two seasons now and let me tell you, they are tough. Super light, great baskets, and the extended padding on the grip is perfect for side-hilling. 10/10 would recommend (:
review.name: Fantastic Poles

review.reviewBody: Best looking, very light and perfect for touring. My favourite poles I’ve owned yet.
review.name: Best poles on the market!

name: MTN Carbon S3 Ski Poles

hasVariant.description: Buy the Specialized Hover Alloy Handlebar online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Jay reviewed the bars in August 2021 and found the drop is 130mm NOT 103mm. He contacted Specialized and they confirmed 130mm. CC reached out to help Jay BUT have never changed the drop spec from the incorrect 103mm to 130mm. I've used a similar Specialized Expert alloy road riser bar (no flare) and the measurements were correct. This happens often actually - seen it with older Zipp bars and FSA bars.
review.name: Read the Review - Specs Are Wrong

review.reviewBody: This handlebar is sold through distributors all over the country (and perhaps around the world). The drop was designed to be 103 mm as stated on every reseller website, with information from Specialized (so not the fault of resellers like competitive cyclist). However the company that prides itself in engineering and charges premium prices by boasting about the same could not get 103 versus 130 right. These handlebars have a drop of 130 mm, NOT the industry-distinguishing 103mm claimed. It's not just a typo either, the packaging lists the drop at 103 and the description talks about the comfortable shallow drop. Did someone drop the ball in design and engineering, manufacturing, quality control? Seems to be all three! Response to me from Specialized was that AFTER I notified them they checked and yes, it is 130 mm. But then, no solution, they signed off with a "happy pedaling". In other words "you customers don't matter and you pay the price for our mistakes".  So confidence inspiring! :)
review.name: Incompetent engineering
comment:
Hi,
Jay sorry for the frustration on these bars. Give us a call, or chat in and we can help find an alternative for you. Our experts are here to help, call us and we will take care of you.1-888-276-7130

name: Hover Alloy Handlebar

review.reviewBody: These are quality pair of down pants. They feel great. Sizing is true with an extra bit of room so you can pull them on top of your layers. The specs are really off. Size large was 408 grams on the scale.
review.name: Nice quality pants but heavier than specified.

review.reviewBody: Love these pants!  I wish I had discovered them sooner.
review.name: Love these pants!

review.reviewBody: Great pants! My 2nd pair!! Fit well, and gentle wash easily!
review.name: 2nd pair!!

review.reviewBody: As many others have noted, these pants were very baggy in the thighs for me, and I returned them. Otherwise they look well constructed.
review.name: Baggy thighs

review.reviewBody:
I swear large in almost every brand, and they should have fit according to the sizing guide, but these large were way, way too big.  I ended up returning the Large and getting a pair in Medium, which fit so much better.   
Overall, I really like these insulated pants.  The fabric repels dirt and snow, keeping me warm and dry.  My only complaint is that they are quite loud.  I thought I would wear them for cross-country skiing, but they'll likely be too. disruptive.  But for general purpose outdoors in winter, they are great.  The stretch is sufficient to keep me moving.
review.name: Loud, big, but great!

review.reviewBody: Warm and cozy. Used at camp, not for hiking. Perfect fit.
review.name: MH down pant

review.reviewBody: As suggested, I got a size smaller than I usually get. There was extra room in the legs but none in the waist. As a wheelchair user, my belly shifts, and these pants were extremely uncomfortable because of the waist. I got petite, and the length was great when sitting (a tad too long if standing). Also, they didn't keep me any warmer than my everyday sweatpants. For $200, I want something warmer than that!
review.name: Not warm, and not comfortable sitting

review.reviewBody: These are perfect to have for cold dog walks, apres ski or run. They’re perfect. Run a little big but no complaints.
review.name: Essential Layer!

review.reviewBody: These pants are insanely warm. They’re perfect for outdoor adventures, river trips, camping, etc in the fall and winter once things cool off. They’re definitely larger around the waist but honestly they work well with layering pants so it doesn’t bother me. The fit around the calf on me is more tight than expected but also doesn’t bother me since they totally get the job done and are an amazing down pant.
review.name: Very warm, great staple for winter adventures

review.reviewBody: I hear a lot of reviews saying they are roomy in the butt and thighs… a dream for big butted adventurers like me! I typically struggle with adventure gear only working for athletic builds, but these fit great! I have a big waist to hip difference and there is a cinch to help keep the waist tight. The rise is great, goes up to my belly button. I got a size large so they wouldn’t be tight in the butt or thighs and they drape beautifully, with plenty of room for base layers. If you’re a curvy gal these are for you!
review.name: For the gal with a big peach!

name: Stretchdown Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: This jacket is perfect for Bay Area weather.  Warm but not too warm and is very comfortable:) If you are a smedium like me with broad shoulders/small stature (~5’7” 150lbs), go for the medium, the small is too snug.
review.name: Super warm and comfortable!:)

review.reviewBody:
I really wanted to like this jacket. It was as warm and comfortable as expected. The fit was nice. I'm 6-4 240lbs with a formerly athletic build and XL fit me almost perfect with a base layer underneath. 

Unfortunately this jacket shed like crazy on everything. This was especially prevalent on anything nylon. Just for day-to-day wear it covered my seatbelt and my laptop bag strap with gray fuzz. I was pretty sure that if i were to wear it backpacking or similar I would have been left with no material anywhere in the vicinity of any straps. 

Product returned based on shedding.
review.name: Sheds worse than my Golden Retriever

review.reviewBody: I will return it, so that someone else can have it. Size M
review.name: the green color too light

review.reviewBody: If you want to look like a muppet, buy this in light plume gray. If you want to be taken seriously, buy it in any other color. Jacket seems really nice.
review.name: Color is much lighter than photos

review.reviewBody: Awesome fit and quality. Color is a bit lighter than the picture shown.(sage khaki)
review.name: Great fit, wrong color..

review.reviewBody: I'm 6'5, 205 lbs and got a large.  Super comfortable and fits perfect.  Highly recommend.  Haven't seen any issues with shedding yet but i assume it will happen
review.name: Great fit, super comfortable

hasVariant.description: Buy the Continental Xynotal 29in Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Ive always been a Maxxis man because everyone tells me I should love them but these Continentals are actually amazing. I replaced an Assegai and DHRII with the Xynotal DH casing in the rear and Enduro casing in the front. Probably could've gone with enduro casing on both and been fine but these things are designed for exactly what they claim; loose over hardpack, square rocks and massive amounts of grip over it all. The compound is pretty soft on the these tires and Im a bigger guy. So, I may go through 2-3 sets per season due to the soft compound but Im okay with that because the performance is amazing on these things. Truly what Ive been looking for in a tire for Colorado!
review.name: WOAH! Love'em!

name: Xynotal 29in Tire

review.reviewBody:
Bike customization tier list is tricky.  some folks think a matching stem & clamp are S tier.  some folks thing wheel & fork decals are top of the list.  

Personally speaking - the fine details are the ones that matter.  Would you rather shout at someone; "HEY LOOK MY BIKE IS CUSTOMIZED!", or whisper it with a grimace that makes that immediately triggers jealousy.  Needless to say - that's what these lockrings are.  subtle little reminders that you have paid the utmost attention to your bike.

Only reason this is 4/5 stars - these cassette tool splines didn't play nicely with the 2021 preload adjuster on chris king hubs (rear only).  you could probably file down the top, but I care more about my precious hubs than the splash of color.
review.name: Coolest Customization

name: Centerlock Rotor Lockring - Internal Spline

review.reviewBody: I am on the East Coast, so we don’t have the biggest mountains, but I still find myself skinning up multiple times per day without getting tired too much. I did not have the chance to use them in deep powder yet, but I have seen quite a lot of snow in the glades and felt like I had a lot of support and float. On the groomers I had more problem than with my frontside skis, but I assume its because of the larger width and the more important rockers I am not used to have. Yet, I was surprised by their stiffness and the speed I could reach comfortably knowing they are not made for this type of skiing.
review.name: Super Light!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wore this jacket as an outer layer in Patagonia and it was amazing as both a raincoat and windbreaker in severe weather. Flattering fit with enough room for several layers underneath. Adjustable hood and vents. Bought my usual size. I am petite so arms were a bit long but I could fold the sleeves.
review.name: Perfect for outdoor activities

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this jacket! The fit is great, and I love that the pockets have been moved up. It makes it much easier to access items in your pockets when wearing a pack with a hip strap. I tested it out for the first time in hours of hiking in rain and fog and it held up perfectly. Also the vent flap zippers are much easier to use than in a previous similar marmot rain coat I had.
review.name: Awesome jacket!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Folks, its important that you appreciate why the pockets are high cut. Many who buy this jacket intend to use it backpacking and/or climbing. In either case the pockets are high to allow you access to them if you're wearing a pack or a climbing harness. Overall a great, well-built, and LIGHT hard shell that should last more than a few seasons.
review.name: Gore-Tex Minimalist Pro Jacket

review.reviewBody: People stop with those complaints about high pockets!!!!! They are designed to be able to reach when you have a back pack with hip and chest calips on the front of your body so they are not covered.
review.name: Google and learn a  bit before buying

review.reviewBody: I returned this because I was unable to use the high pockets for my hands (I like to keep them dry in the rain too).  The length was significantly shorter than the rain jacket I was replacing.  I was concerned that all the water running off would land on my crotch if wearing this without rain pants.  The quality of construction and water proofing material seemed excellent.
review.name: High pockets, short length
comment:
Thank you for providing us with feedback on our product. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.

We are very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations.

At Marmot, we strive for excellence and we set a high standard for ourselves, and we are so sorry to hear this was not met in your interaction with our brand. We greatly value our consumers' insights, which are collected and shared with our product development teams for consideration. We appreciate your effort and do hope that you will reconsider using Marmot products in the future.

We are happy to assist in resolving any issues you may experience with our products.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: I took this jacket, in yellow, along with another gortex one from a very well known, reputable brand. While the other one provided more coverage, it began to let moisture in after long exposures to rain. My Marmot jacket kept me completely dry underneath no matter how much rain or moisture I was exposed to.
review.name: Kept me completely dry in Iceland!

review.reviewBody: No issues with the quality of this jacket, but the design is terrible. The pockets are not like what is shown in the photo, they are only a few inches long at breast height so can’t put your hands in them, and very awkward to use them at all. Even putting a dog bag in them because it’s difficult to get in and out, and then you have a lump right on your chest. Highly recommend other Marmot gear, but not this one.
review.name: Quality, but bad design

review.name: Great quality, the zipper is even protected

review.reviewBody: Light weight and sturdy. Great rain jacket for the price.

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra Alpine GORE-TEX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Absolutely love this shoe but had to send it back because it’s very small and narrow sizing - and I mean very small. It’s a pity they don’t state the sizing in the blurb. I love the shoe though, and will order size 10 once the other one has cleared checks.
review.name: Great shoe but v v small fitting

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra Alpine GORE-TEX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Very comfortable and stylish hiking shoe.

I have it for about 3 weeks and enjoyed my first hike with it. It was a really comfortable shoe
review.name: Comfortable and stylish

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra Alpine GORE-TEX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have 50 miles of hiking on these shoes. They are a well made approach/hiking shoe. I would definitely consider this an approach shoe because it has the stronger toe cap and the sole flex is very stiff. They have broken in over these 50 miles I've put on them on the trails and just day to day wear. Over all the shoe is exactly what I have come to expect from a Salomon hiker. Top notch quality. When it comes to fit, that is where these differ from other hikers I have had in the past. I will state I am a low volume foot (based on alpine touring ski boots and cycling shoes). The foot entry hole on my pair of Ultra Alpine X are larger than Salomon Ultra I have had in the past. And larger than Speedcross as well. Because of the size of the shoe entry and the stiffness of the sole, I got heel slippage, thus got blisters on the inside and outside of both left and right heels on my first 4 mile hike. This is the first time any Salomon had given me blisters straight out of the box. I have worn them with various thickness of socks, and I still have heel slippage. Salomon are my reliable shoes. I was disappointed, but also see what is happening. Ultimately this is a shoe that does not fit my foot well, and I am a low volume foot. I do believe a mid to high volume foot would work in these shoes with no issue. They design, style, and construction are top notch as I would expect from Salomon. I just will be looking for different models that best accommodate a low volume foot.
review.name: Great hiking shoe for the right foot

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra Alpine GORE-TEX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've worm Salomon's for years, running shoes, hiking boots, you name it and they all fit me fine. These I sent back because they are way too narrow. I think since it's an approach shoe they felt it should fit like a rock climbing shoe. I wish they at least offered a wide version.
review.name: Way too narrow

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra Alpine GORE-TEX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Just had these a few weeks.  They are the same size as my Quests, XA Ultra shoes, mids and boots.  They are a half size smaller than my Hokas, Lowa running shoes and Saucony as well as Salomon running shoes.
I bought them for winter walking, daily wear and light hiking through the cold and wet PNW weather.  They are sturdy, stable and well cushioned, but there lighter weight options out there if you’re actually going to use them for hard use hiking.  I can easily wear a mid weight sock with my normal size.  I’m not a fan of the cinch laces used through the Salomon lineup and would prefer standard laces, but am a big fan of approach style, lace to toe.
review.name: Sturdy shoe, same size as other Salomons

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra Alpine GORE-TEX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I find this shoe to one of the better releases from Salomon in a long time. I’ve had/numerous versions of the 3D product and found the older releases to be more comfortable and fitting than the newer releases. I look forward to adding more of the Alpines to my collection if they prove out (and if the price comes down).
review.name: X Ultra Alpine Gortex

name: X Ultra Alpine GORE-TEX Hiking Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great tent. Lightweight, zipper and fabric quality is real good. Instructions are easy. Fast setup and takedown. Fit 2 adults comfortably.
review.name: Great tent for Backpacking.

review.reviewBody: I purchased the Maxfield 4 tent and used it less than 5 times before it ripped during set-up. Nothing was forced, we were just attaching a clip to a pole. This tent has a warranty, but Klymit said this is an uncovered situation. Either their product is garbage or their warranty is garbage.
review.name: Klymit does not stand behind their products

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchase this tent, I set it up in my garage by weighting down the corners to allow the tent to stand, during the process the screen on the tent ripped along the top bar connections, i'm not sure if the tent had a hole initially and they why it ripped of it it was manufactured wrong and was to tight. Regardless of that, i have wrote Gathr outdoors twice now and have yet to receive any response back in regards to a warranty for this tent. im very disappointed at this time with the lack of customer service i am receiving. My previous experience with buying higher end products is the customer service is impeccable, But this is not the case with Gathr Outdoors. I really hope to hear from someone soon so i can return my tent and get a new one to actually be able to use it.
review.name: Poor Customer Service

review.reviewBody:
The tent is made of good, lightweight materials. Unless the kids destroy this, I suspect it will last me a long time.

It's pretty lightweight and the semi-freestanding setup doesn't make it too difficult to setup, just stake out the base 1st and then it's nearly the same.

One thing that does annoy me if I haven't set it up for a while, because it's an assymetric tent, is knowing which is the front and which is the back for the rainfly. Yes, they color code the straps and loops and everything but more than once I've been off by one attachment point and had to shift the whole thing and it's not hard to reverse the entire pole assembly thing by having it upside down.

What helped me a lot is to simply write with marker "front" and "back" on the body and fly as these are the parts the really need lined up as the sides can be easier to get off by one corner. It just slows things down and if I have the little ones running around, a 1-minute adjustment can easily turn into a 5-minute adjustment as the kids love to sit on the body or fly when it's not suspended. I'm all about making the pitch easier and I found actually labeling things made the process easier where there's only one-for-one point to match up instead of several.

Oh yeah, also labeled the footprint which makes things easier for knowing which side to pitch into the wind as the backside should be into the wind for aerodynamics.
review.name: Good tent, setup could use some tricks

review.reviewBody: not free standing, have to peg it down, which means try getting it up in sand or rock
review.name: not free standing, have to

review.reviewBody:
I bought this as part of a gear upgrade as I now have two kiddos, aged 9 months and 2.5 years that I wanted to take with me on backpacking trips. So I needed more room than my old 2-person backpacking tent had.

I've got to say, I'm super pleased with this tent. The design is a little strange at first. You stake down the tent to the ground and rely on the tension created from this process to then complete the assembly, so in that regard the ability to drives stakes all the way into the ground is important so I bought a hammer/hatchet for that purpose. 
The pole system is also a little odd - not bad, just odd - in that it combines the function of three poles into one pole system. It's difficult to explain in text, but it isn't that complicated and is really a clever design. 

The whole thing rolls up into a bag instead of a traditional stuff sack which is also cool. You can unroll the bag that the tent comes in and use it as a doormat once you get it set up.

In terms of room, there is plenty for our family of four. There's a door on either side, one big and one small. Two pockets on the ceiling and two loops as well to string up a light. 

Set the whole thing up in 15 minutes moving at a leisurely pace. Breakdown / storage in the neighborhood of 20 minutes. Again though, this is also while dealing with my kids etc. If you were going for speed, you could probably have it up in about five minutes. 

I would recommend setting it up in the backyard before you get out on your camping trip though. As I said, the design is clever but it is not like any tent I have seen before so you'll want to be familiar with it so you aren't trying to figure it out for the first time in the cold or if you're racing against sunset. 

Used it five times so far in 40 degree night time weather. It's kept us warm and I haven't noticed any defects. Overall I'm very impressed. I also bought Kylmit's two person sleeping bag and sleeping pad to use with the family and recommend those as well.
review.name: I bought this as part

review.reviewBody: Takes a couple of practice rounds to set this tent up efficiently but once you have it down, it is great. Have used in many nights in many conditions and it has stood up to the tests.
review.name: Takes a couple of practice

review.reviewBody: So far really enjoying this tent. First couple pitches were clumsy, as the poles have to be oriented a certain way, and it can be difficult to completely zip the vestibule fly when already inside the tent, but otherwise I love the internal space and thoughtful design.
review.name: So far really enjoying this

review.reviewBody: My first light-weight tent, not too tough to set up. Love the burrito roll, too bad it's not free-standing!
review.name: My first light-weight tent, not

review.reviewBody:
The Maxfield 4, definitely fits four people. Maybe even more if you're willing to squeeze in or if you're smaller in size. Most recently used it on a cross-country road trip with two dogs. Plenty of space, even with two dogs that love to move around. 

When it came to setting up, my first time was a bit tricky, but after getting a hang of it, set up is easy and straightforward, even if you're setting up alone. The poles and it's corresponding attachment points are color-coded so even on your first time you won't have to fumble around figuring out which pole goes where. 

When it comes to taking down and packing away the tent, it does not come with a bag, instead it is a sack that rolls up. This removes the hassle of trying to perfectly fold a tent so it fits into it's bag. Place all the gear on the sack and roll it up. Next time you need it, just unroll and all your gear is there. With it all packed up, it is light and easy to carry. 

With the assembled tent, the vestibules are awesome for keeping smelly gear outside of the tent, but also still kind of inside the tent. If it's hot and sunny, you can double the vestibule flap as a sunshade (it's not intended, but definitely works) if you attach it high instead of the ground. If it rains, there was no issue with getting wet whatsoever. However, I did not experience torrential rain, just light to medium rainfall.
review.name: Lightweight and compact

description: Buy the Kelty Loveseat online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Loveseat
hasVariant.description: Buy the Kelty Loveseat online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Loveseat
hasVariant.description: Buy the Kelty Loveseat online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Worth every penny. The low seat is much more comfortable than the regular height as it allows you to lean back more. Finally get to cuddle with my partner.
review.name: Loving the Loveseat

review.reviewBody: It's heavy and cumbersome but great for what it is. Sadly on it's first use it got a flying ember on it and  burned a hole in the fabric.
review.name: Cuddle up

review.reviewBody: The quality is great and it?s not super heavy to carry, but we ultimately returned it and purchased the Kelty low loveseat as this seat was a bit too high off the ground. My husband is 6? and I?m 5?7? and sitting upright is comfortable but the front edge of the seat is firm and was not overly comfortable on the back of the thighs. If you slouch back it?s just high enough from the ground that we wanted a foot rest. So, we opted to return for the low loveseat hoping it will be the more comfortable option for us. Shout out to customer service rep who walked me through the return/exchange process and ensured that we could reuse our promo code to purchase the low loveseat!!
review.name: Wanted to love this

review.reviewBody: Ordered the regular height Loveseat for my wife and I. Color was great and the roll up style carrying bag was nice. Our problem was the area where the back of our legs were against the seat edge. It felt narrow  and rigid. The top of the seat legs pressed into my legs. We wanted to keep it, but just couldn't get past that problem.
review.name: Loveseat

review.reviewBody: This love seat is very well built and comfortable. Bought to take on camping trips, we tried this out in the living room since camping in MT. is still months away.
review.name: Sturdy

review.reviewBody: Loveseat is awesome!!  Very heavy so good for car camping or short distance carry and set up. Much heavier than carrying 2 camp chairs but way cooler than having separate chairs around camp or on the beach. Great for intimate campfire connection. Couldn?t be happier with the love seat!!
review.name: Awesome camp chair

review.reviewBody: This is a great car camping companion, our kid was always sitting on our lap in our other camp chairs but they became unstable as he has gotten bigger.  I ordered this one thinking that it was the lower model, however it is working out ok.  Super heavy, so that limits how far it travels from the car. It is comfortable for what it is.  Wish they would come out with a new lighter model and maybe switch back to the shorter one.
review.name: Camp Loveseat

review.reviewBody: I already have the low version and love it. We bought this one to keep on the porch, but ended up returning it.  It was just a few inches too tall and uncomfortable to sit on.   The seat height was taller than all of our other camp chairs.
review.name: A little too tall...

review.reviewBody: Great chair! Had one, lost it or got stolen, so had to get a new one. Really comfortable even with two of us on it.
review.name: campfire cozy

name: Loveseat

description: Buy the Kelty Camp Galley online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Camp Galley
hasVariant.description: Buy the Kelty Camp Galley online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: We often travel in the car. This is a very neat companion for the car refrigerator we bought to keep our food cold. It’s neat and compact enough to leave in our car in between trips. It holds  paper plastic plates, eating utensils, napkins and paper towels for easy access.
review.name: Nice buy

review.reviewBody: WOW is this item fit nearly EVERYTHING for your camp kitchen needs.  I have the following items inside and space to add more.  Garlic Salt, Pepper, cooking utensils (knives, spatula, ladle, thongs), eating utensils (forks, knives and spoons), two sponges, paper plates, garbage bags, kitchen towels, aim n flame, 10" ultra light pan, 8" ultra light pan, Clorox wipes, collapsible cup (250ml), collapsible 1L pot, dishwashing detergent, aluminum foil & 2 thin cutting boards.  It's very lightweight and compact with all those items inside.  HUGE SPACE SAVER!  Worth every penny!
review.name: Everything but the kitchen sink

review.reviewBody:
Great price, high quality camping travel item storage.
We will enjoy packing and using the galley.
review.name: Kelty Camp Galley Deluxe

name: Camp Galley

review.reviewBody:
Had this helmet for a few years & just got a new one! Personally love the fit of this helmet! Typically I fit a Smith ski helmet in a Medium perfectly and in the Strutter I wear a M/L. I do have a averageish/narrowish head. Helmet is adjustable, comfortable, and looks great. 

Every helmet fits different but for long days on the river kicking it with the crew or cruising some waves I always grab this one!
review.name: Huge Fan of This Helmet!!!!

review.reviewBody: I wear a S typically in helmets and bought the S/M. The helmet felt like it was squeezing the sides of my head, but felt find on the forehead and back of my head, almost as if it was shaped as a very oblong oval. I could sense that wearing it all day on the river would be a recipe for a headache, so I returned it. It seems like this is a common issue for folks based on the comments below. Otherwise, I liked the adjustment features and look of the helmet.
review.name: Uncomfortably Narrow

review.reviewBody: I wear a L/XL in most hats and this helmet fits true to that sizing.  Very adjustable, I love the easy adjustment at the base of the neck.  The chin straps are a little bulky but they also offer a lot of adjustment so it's a good give/take.  I have purchased two of these helmets.  The first one broke after two years of use...the break was a packing error, my bad.  Bought the second one without hesitation.  I use it for kitesurfing.  LOVE IT!
review.name: LOVE IT!

review.reviewBody: I have about 5 ww helmets all in the M or M/L size, but this is my first Strutter. I think I have a fairly normal head shape and fall right in the middle, even towards the smaller side, of the M/L size range. Without any of the extra padding, this helmet is bizarrely narrow and crushes my temples with immense, painful pressure. I read the booklet that came with it and had everything adjusted to be as loose as possible to start the fit process, but just couldn't have the thing on for more than a few moments without getting terrible headaches. In addition to this, the stitching and basic texture of the black cover over the hard foam shell is just not nice on my head. I have a shaved/bald head and it irritates my skin like no other helmet. The black material isn't very soft and the stitching at the edge over my eyebrows is downright painful. All in all, I'm really disappointed in this helmet considering all the great things I've heard about it from others. Maybe I just got an off one, but it's definitely not right for me.
review.name: Looks nice; uncomfortable and weird fit

name: Strutter Helmet

review.itemreviewed: Tallac Clip BOA Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought this shoe for the boa-velcro closure combo.  I have high arches (a high volume foot), so the single boa shoes don't work for me.   I use this shoe as a commuter shoe (15 miles each way) a couple of times a week on a Niner RLT RDO and just wear  them all day at work.  I like a stiff shoe, so wearing them all day at work is not a problem for me.  What is a problem, is that Ride Concepts told me the spd cleat would be fully recessed.  Well, if you stuff it all the way to the back of the cleat track it is, but I like mine about in the middle, which on these shoes makes the cleat just slightly proud = clicking on the floor if you do anything other than walking in a straight line.
review.name: Great shoe, cleat not fully recessed

name: Tallac Clip BOA Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: This rope is amazing! As a beginner I was having a hard time finding a rope with all the options on the market but this one is perfect with the easily identifiable middle marker and its diameter and length are just right. 10/10 would recommend
review.name: First climbing rope

review.reviewBody: Dual patterned for people like me who can never find the faded middle mark that's no more than one inch wide. I'll never die from slipping off one strand ever again. - ghost of zanda
review.name: Dual pattern

review.reviewBody: The rope does exactly what I need it to and feels great to handle. Bi-pattern design makes it easy to coil. I recommend this.
review.name: Great rope

review.reviewBody: Great and reliable rope. The bi-pattern makes finding the midpoint easy. The material slides well through your belay device, but will grab when pausing when lowering.
review.name: 9.6 Bi-Pattern

review.reviewBody: I have a lot of ropes. This is my favorite, because the thickness is perfect, it's pretty, and the bi-pattern makes it so easy to find the middle when rappelling.
review.name: Best rope yet

review.reviewBody: Runs smoothly through GriGri. Catches well. Bi-pattern is quite convenient.
review.name: Great outdoor rope

review.reviewBody: After 10 or so effective days in Indian creek (climbing a lot but falling very little), the rope has a core shot, a second one is developing and it looks very worn overall. I've never had a rope wearing so fast in my 15 years of rock climbing...
review.name: Destroyed surprisingly fast

review.reviewBody: I’ve been through three ropes as a climber, this is by far the best one I’ve ever had. The diameter is ideal for long routes as it’s easy to handle, lightweight, and the bi-pattern adds that extra sense of security to know where you are on the rope. I’ve never had any issues with my Black Diamond ropes getting worn unevenly or not lasting.
review.name: Greatest Rope Ever

review.reviewBody: Great rope! will definitely last through some more demanding adventures in the mountains
review.name: Great rope! will definitely last

review.reviewBody: I will never again by a rope without this. The pattern makes rope management way easier. Also dry rope durability is solid.
review.name: Great Bi-Pattern rope

name: 9.6mm Dry Bi-Pattern Rope

Hello,

Thank you for providing us with feedback on the jacket.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a super bomber jacket!  Super durable and great fit -- our 6 and 9 year olds love them.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm 5'2" and 130 lbs and I bought this jacket in XL cause I'm not always a fan of the shape/darting on women's jackets and wanted a more relaxed fit. It's packable, a good value, and keeps me dry! I wear this jacket constantly up here in the Pacific Northwest. Only issue I have is that the sleeves come up a tad short, but most of the time I don't even notice. I'll also mention that the jacket's waterproofing will only go so far, but the only time that has ever been a problem is when I'm cycling in the pouring rain for extended periods. For the price, I think it's an awesome deal.
review.name: Great for petite women/AFAB folks

review.reviewBody:
Giro Empire SLX Shoes: Unparalleled Performance and Stylish Design

When it comes to cycling shoes, finding the perfect balance between performance, comfort, and style is paramount. The Giro Empire SLX Shoes effortlessly deliver on all fronts, making them a top choice for discerning cyclists. With their lightweight construction, exceptional power transfer, and sleek design, these shoes are a game-changer in the world of cycling footwear.

One of the standout features of the Giro Empire SLX Shoes is their incredible weight. Weighing in at a mere 175 grams, these shoes are incredibly light, making them ideal for riders looking to minimize excess weight and maximize speed. The lightweight construction doesn't compromise on durability, as the shoes are made with high-quality materials that ensure long-lasting performance.

The power transfer provided by the Giro Empire SLX Shoes is truly unmatched. Thanks to the Easton EC90 SLX2 carbon fiber outsole, every watt of power generated by the cyclist is efficiently transferred to the pedals. This translates into a noticeable increase in speed and overall performance. Whether you're sprinting for the finish line or conquering a challenging climb, these shoes provide the support and responsiveness needed to push your limits.

Comfort is of utmost importance during long rides, and the Giro Empire SLX Shoes excel in this area as well. The shoes feature a SuperNatural Fit Kit, which allows for a customizable fit. With three arch support options, riders can tailor the shoes to their specific needs, ensuring maximum comfort and minimizing the risk of discomfort or pain. The breathable Evofiber upper promotes excellent airflow, keeping your feet cool and dry even during intense rides.

In addition to their exceptional performance, the Giro Empire SLX Shoes also boast a sleek and stylish design that sets them apart from the competition. The minimalist yet eye-catching design is a testament to Giro's commitment to combining form and function seamlessly. Whether you opt for the classic black or one of the vibrant color options, these shoes are sure to turn heads on the road or at the local coffee shop.

The attention to detail in the Giro Empire SLX Shoes is evident throughout. The replaceable heel pads ensure longevity and make maintenance a breeze. The traditional lace-up closure not only adds to the shoes' aesthetic appeal but also allows for a more precise fit, eliminating pressure points and maximizing comfort. The reflective elements on the shoes enhance visibility in low-light conditions, prioritizing safety on the road.

It's worth mentioning that the Giro Empire SLX Shoes may not be the ideal choice for riders who prefer the convenience of a quick closure system like BOA dials or Velcro straps. While the laces offer a classic and secure fit, they may require more time and effort to adjust compared to other closure systems. However, for those who appreciate the timeless charm of laces and don't mind the extra minute or two spent tightening or loosening them, this shouldn't be a significant drawback.

In terms of sizing, it's important to note that the Giro Empire SLX Shoes tend to run slightly small. It is advisable to try them on or consult the manufacturer's sizing chart before making a purchase. This will help ensure that you select the right size and experience the optimal fit for your feet.

In conclusion, the Giro Empire SLX Shoes are a testament to Giro's dedication to crafting top-tier cycling footwear. Their lightweight design, exceptional power transfer, customizable fit, and stylish aesthetic make them a standout choice for serious cyclists. While the lace closure system may not be for everyone, those who appreciate the traditional charm and don't mind the extra adjustment time will find these shoes to be a perfect match. So, if you're ready to elevate your cycling experience to new heights, slip into a pair of Giro Empire SLX
review.name: Unparalleled Performance and Design

review.reviewBody: This is my third pair of Giro’s.  All have been comfortable and have a solid road feel.  Six years and tens of thousands of miles and each still going strong.  After my fifth ride in the new SLX l noticed two divots out of the toe on my right shoe.  A first for any pair of my Giro’s.  The new SLX is light with a glove like fit but the material is thin.  Compared to my other pairs I’m a little concerned about the durability of this shoe.
review.name: Durability

review.reviewBody:
Very comfortable going looking shoe.  Air flow design will be perfect for the hot summer days in Sacramento, CA.  I only ride in a Giro because of comfort and aesthetic style.  Go Giro Go!
(40 years of running have taught me the importance of essential gear - Giro fits the bill)
review.name: Empire SLX Cycling Shoe - Men's

name: Empire SLX Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: We purchased the Better Sweater as a gift for our daughter. It is true to fit and color. Well made and a perfect gift. We’re saving it for her Xmas gift! But let her try it on ahead of time!
review.name: Sweater

review.reviewBody: I have 4 Better Sweaters and this one is my favorite now because it fits perfectly.  The small is a true to fit size with a stylish curve.
review.name: Stylish cut and warm

review.reviewBody: This is my new favorite pullover for skiing. Not too tight, not too baggy, and plenty warm.
review.name: Warmest ski layer

review.reviewBody:
My favorite brand .Never disappoint for sure.Keep me pretty warm.Well made 

Sharon
review.name: Prefect for cooler weather

review.reviewBody: It's a high-quality fleece with a nice design, the perfect mid-layer for ski/snowboarding or other winter outdoor sports.
review.name: Very warm and comfortable

review.reviewBody: Bought the hazy purple in a L as a gift for my mom. The sizing is a bit on the smaller side as she would normally be a borderline M/L, but the fit is perfect. The material is so soft, and it makes for a great midlayer under a heavier jacket for winter walks or hikes. Beautiful design, and works well on its own for cool fall or mild winter days.
review.name: Warm and stylish fleece

review.reviewBody: Great color and warmth.  But it was a tight fit. I bought these as a gift for someone who wears either a S or a M. I got a M. Could’ve done with a L in these. Patagonia sizes are so weird.
review.name: Almost

review.reviewBody: I so wanted to like this sweater,  but never really found the correct size. Medium was tightin chest, but large had an oversized look.  Went with the medium, but it never was comfortable.  Also the collar was very itchy, and each time I wore it I got a rash on my chin area.  I ended up selling it back to Patagonia.  Despite them calling it “ like new “ condition, I received about 1/3 of what I paid for it.   Sorry I wasted my money on it.  I feel unless you’re tall and thin( no curves at all ) Patagonia clothing does not fit women correctly.  I’ve given up on this brand.
review.name: Itchy

review.reviewBody: Bought this for an August trip to Alaska, and it was a perfect layer for the varying temps. Thin enough to wear under a jacket when it was cold but thick enough to wear over a shirt on milder days.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody:
Great sweater. Very comfortable and warm.
Runs a little small so if between sizes go up a size.
review.name: COZY AND WARM

review.reviewBody:
Skied a half dozen days on these so far in Colorado in all conditions. Very intuitive and easy ski to read. This is a fun one-quiver ski for someone who likes to ski in a quick, light, and nimble style (fast and tight turns). Playful, forgiving, center oriented, easy to slarve. Very agile in the bumps and trees, carves well, and performs adequately well in powder as a soft ski with a relatively high amount of rocker. Relatively short turning radius (19m @ 182cm).

This ski is not for someone who likes to ski relatively fast, making big, wider-arcing turns. High amount of rocker and soft tips means the ski chatters noticeably though I still find it to be a good carver due to lateral stability under foot. In mixed conditions, the ski wants you to float over crud rather than slash your way through it. It lacks the muscle and stiffness for the latter. If you are looking for a ski primarily for piste skiing / groomers this is also not the right ski. It's a playful ski for more playful terrain and skiing styles.

So, this isn't a ski for everyone but so far suits me really well and I'm loving them. If you're more of a painter than a blacksmith, you may like these too.
review.name: Fun all around skis

name: Slap 104 Ski - 2025

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comfortable and stylish boots. I love them! I walk my dogs a few times a day and these are so warm and comfortable that I don't mind going out in the cold.
review.name: Great boots!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’ve been wearing these for 5 years. I finally replaced them with the same exact pair. I wear these things every. Single. Day. They have survived extreme amounts of paint and wood being dropped on them. I leave in upstate New York, and they handle the snow and ice amazingly. They also keep my feet warm. Favorite pair of shoes I’ve ever owned.
review.name: Favorite Boots

review.reviewBody: Absolutely no support or insulation.  They are also too small.  Hate them
review.name: Horrible
comment: We are sorry that your experience did not meet your expectations. We take all feedback seriously and will do our best to improve the product in the future.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this boots. Been wearing this to work for a week now and it’s just perfect for me so far. I work in a cold room, with wet floors and cold conditions (34 degrees Fahrenheit). I’ve tried every work boots available in the market but didn’t work for me until I came across this one. I love how this boots is not too heavy. It’s comfortable and keeps my feet warm. It’s also waterproof so it’s a plus. The style is not so bad either. The fit is very on point and the price is pretty reasonable. Will definitely buy another pair.
review.name: Great Boots

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are really cute and very lightweight which is a bonus. I also love how easy they are to slip on and pull the laces up tight which makes them perfect for errands and quick trips outside. But…I bought these to go out in the snow and while they are waterproof, they are NOT warm. The tops of my feet freeze! I went back to my Sorel boots. Bummer, I was looking for another kind with similar warmth.
review.name: Cute but Not Functional

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I chose the Ice Maiden II boots because the reviews said they were warm and I like the appearance.  I am happy with the appearance, very pretty, but dissatisfied with the warmth.  I have them on my feet as I write this review.  It is 68 degrees in my house, 32 degrees outside.  My feet are freezing!🥶. 

The only other issue I have is the insole is thin and flat.  When I walk, it feels like the boots are separating beneath the arch in each foot, with every step.  I put another insole in that has arch support and is thicker.  That fixed the problem and made the boot more comfortable.
review.name: Surprised the reviews are high on this boot.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] What is this sorcery!? I have slipped these on three times now without socks just to run outside quickly, but ended up staying out to shovel and even with my feet literally in 20-degree snow — without socks! — I have just come in with toasty warm, dry feet. How is this possible? I don’t know, but I’m not gonna spend much time questioning a good thing.
review.name: MAGIC

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The boots are the best. They really do keep your feet warm and they are very comfortable from the first wear. Your ankles don’t feel restricted and they feel like they have been broke on for years. I love these boots !!!
review.name: Excellent boot

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Not a fan! While these boots are super comfortable. The Omni grip soles have let me down too many times! At first I thought it was because my shoes needed to be replaced so I purchased another pair but I had the same result of falling in them, my newest pair a couple of times. The sole showing signs of wear much sooner than my other Columbia boots that I wear fair more frequently!

If you are purchasing these for fashion and comfort you will love them and I highly recommend them! If you are purchasing them for safety, keep looking! They don't live up to the usual Omni grip status of most Columbia shoes.
review.name: It depends on what your goal for your purchase is
comment: Thank you for taking the time to write your review. We appreciate you as a Columbia customer and your feedback is what helps us improve our products. Please feel free to contact our customer care team with any other concerns 800-622-6953

review.reviewBody: I purchased these boots. But unfortunately they are to small.  I'm just wondering how I can return them as I don't have my shipping label or order number.

name: Ice Maiden II Boot - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Bridger Mid B-Dry Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: very great product, very sturdy! love it!
review.name: Great product, delivered on time

review.itemreviewed: Bridger Mid B-Dry Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I am very picky about boots. To me, it doesnt make sense to spend $150+ on boots that you dont like and dont last. I tried on as many different brands as possible and settled for the Oboz. I really like that they are wider to accommodate my slightly wider feet, and the support and stability of these boots is great. 
However, after only 2 years, the rubber around the toe started to peel and compromised the waterproofing. One of the worst things is to spend so much time and money to get a great boot only to have them fail after 2 years. The second worst thing is to be in the mountains of Wyoming with wet feet in 9F snowy weather....
review.name: Comfortable but doesnt last

review.itemreviewed: Bridger Mid B-Dry Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I love my wide Oboz Bridgers, they're well made, rugged, and comfortable. I originally ordered the regular width version and the toe box was just too tight while everything else fit perfectly for my low volume duck feet. The boot fits a half size small to begin with but even going up to an 11.5 (usually 11) they were still too snug in the toes.

So I reordered the wide version in 11.5 and perfection! Just enough room for happy toes while getting a secure fit over the instep and through the heel. Love these boots for light to medium duty hiking. FYI, these are not heavy duty boots though and won't survive long if used for off-trail duty. But for day hikes on rough trails and backpacking these are perfect.
review.name: Wide is the way

review.itemreviewed: Bridger Mid B-Dry Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Thanks to the great sizing and product recommended by my friendly Gearhead, my feet have been very happy even in this 100 degree Texas heat. Oboz is well worth the money!!!!
review.name: Best engineered footwear ever!

review.reviewBody: I love these sweatpants so much I grabbed two pairs. The zippered pockets are by far my favorite feature, but they fit great and I love the colors they come in! I can’t wait to see what else Cotopaxi makes that I will absolutely fall in love with!

review.reviewBody: So cute. Awesome color. Great customer service in the store. So nice to see and refreshing. This guy seemed to love his job and was super helpful!
review.name: Sweatpants

review.reviewBody:
Ordered the sweat pants in both a small and a medium. I am 60+ woman- 127 lb 5’8
Pants are very nice weight, warm. Zippers are an amazing touch. Great for all activity 
However these run extremely short 
I cannot wear without solid warm tall sock to cover leg at bottom and by doing that they look ridiculous 
The small size fits best, but I thought the medium would be longer-they are not. 
I would not recommend these pants if you’re an average to tall person. 
They are nice looking pants, would work for many things if we’re not so short 
Marked as true to size but no where to state SHORT
review.name: Great but way short

review.reviewBody: I absolutely LOVE these! I’m 5’4, around 145 lbs and I prefer a higher waisted fit. I got a large and they fit perfectly! Warm, cozy, with the best pockets! I highly recommend them to anyone in need of a staple pair of sweats.
review.name: Best sweatpants ever!

review.reviewBody: These are the most flattering and comfortable sweatpants ever! Not big and baggy. I love them. Bought this second pair in a different color from my first because I love them so much. I wear xs or s in Cotopaxi. Xs in these.
review.name: Not your old-school sweatpants

review.reviewBody: Soft and thick. My only complaint would be I wish they were two inches longer in the inseam.
review.name: Fantastic pants

review.reviewBody:
Great way to get cordelettes custom built or even for use as a static support line.

Hold the rope tight, cut with a sharp knife under tension and don't stab yourself once it goes through. Burn the ends with a standard lighter and you're good.

This is an easy rope to work with, it ties knots well and is plenty flexible to dress even the more complex multi-strand BHKs.

review.reviewBody: I find it hard to purchase mittens online, especially a company I haven't worn before. Temp sensitivity is somewhat subjective. My fingers are always cold starting in early Fall and my older gloves weren't keeping me warm.  I got the Hestra Moon Mittens hoping the extra insulation would suffice during daily dog walks. They are super warm and perfect for that purpose. They are thick so not the most dextrous for handling buckles and zippers, but the trade off is the warmth. The length from my wrist to top of middle finger is 7.75" and I ordered a size 9. I haven't purchased this company before so I don't know if that is on par with their other sizing. The 9 Moon Mitten gives me a small buffer of space/air between the end of my hands and the inside seam, which for me is spot on. I love my new mittens.
review.name: Perfect mitt for cold hands

review.reviewBody: The mittens were perfect for skiing Canada (0C temps). Only wish would be for Hestra to include the elastic wrist leashes, like they have on other gloves. I was nervous I was going to drop a mitten off the chair list.
review.name: Very warm - used in Canada!

review.reviewBody: Hestra is one of my favorite brands, and these did not disappoint. These are keeping my hands warm in the cold MN climate.  These run big in my opinion - I normally wear a size 7 in Hestra, but needed to size down to a 6.
review.name: Warm mitten that looks good too!

review.reviewBody: Received these on July 18th, 2024 and have been using them regularly since, fit very well and true to size, consistent with other Altra shoes I've used. I run around 15 trail miles a week in these and other shoes, did a few 20ish mile backpacks and an 80 miler in these shoes. Just like the Olympus 5 design, the strips of Vibram are delaminating from the sole in under 2 months of what, in my opinion, has been moderate use. Will not be warrantying these this time, assume it's a consistent flaw again. Why not just use a full covering of Vibram for the sole?? All of the extra padding in the heel rubs horribly if you have repeated movement in the ankle outside of the neutral position (not great for a trail running shoe). Have never had this experience in a half dozen Altra shoes before.
review.name: Another dud

review.reviewBody: I have been a long time Hoka Stinson wearer for hiking but the soles don't hold up well for Grand Canyon and slick rock hiking. I decided to try the Olympus 6's and have been very pleased. The Vibram soles are grippy and durable with the same plush cushioning that I enjoyed with the Hokas. The Olympus runs about 1/2 smaller than the Hokas which caused the hassle of sending back a pair. There was a break in period for the cushioned heel but felt much better after a week. I'm wearing them for a rim to rim later this month and if they do well with that, I'm hooked.
review.name: Good for hiking in Grand Canyon

review.reviewBody: My shoes were delivered on August 6, 2024. Today is September 5, 2024. The shoes have only been used for light road running and treadmill running, less than 100 miles on them so far and the tongue is already delaminating with inner foam exposed. The shoes are comfortable, which is the only reason I didn't give them 1 star. But for nearly $200 after taxes and shipping, you'd think the quality would be good enough to last more than a month before beginning to fall apart. I was already planning on buying a second pair until I saw the tongue falling apart today. Incredibly disappointing and makes me extremely hesitant to invest in more altra shoes in the future.
review.name: Less than a month and already falling apart

review.reviewBody: I've owned 20+ pairs of Altra's, mainly Torin's over the years. I love this shoe and use it primarily for outdoor F3 workouts in which we cover lots of different terrain and do some high impact work. Over the years, the shoes have narrowed a bit, but this one is pretty true. I did find however that the heel pad is problematic and actually removed it to make room. The grip is amazing and the only complaint I have is that the sole at the heel is quite wide. I've caught it a time or two in the last few wears. I have a sz 15 foot, so I can't be picky, but these will be a definite repeat.
review.name: Great sneak, couple of thoughts...

review.reviewBody: As I prepare for my first tail race (10+ yr Altra road runner!), I'm confident I found my best shoe for the transition! I love the cushion and stability-tread the Olympus offers.
review.name: What a welcome intro trail running!

review.reviewBody: Ive been a big fan of the Olympus for years and several versions. They lost me on this one. It is a tighter fit, which feels a little better than the 5 on technical terrain. They hold my feet well and don't slip as much as past iterations. But that Achilles pillow is a horrible design. It is a blister machine. I've never had blister issues with the Olympus in the past but this new "pillow" just compresses and all that folded fabric and stitching rubs like crazy. I'm surprised it passed testing without a ton of complaints because I'm hearing it from everyone. It's too bad.
review.name: Loved every Olympus, until this one

review.reviewBody: Ran two 20 mile trails and completed a 50k all within a few weeks of owning these. I truly love them and have officially found my go to trail shoes.
review.name: Incredible.

review.reviewBody: I'm an Altra purist and have been for 3 or 4 years. I have road and trail styles, but with the Olympus 6, Altra just outdid themselves. I purchased these for trail running on small gravel/dirt trails around the beach trails in the hills of the SoCal coast. Nothing technical, just a good sturdy and grippy shoe. The structure and protection level in the Olympus 6 is perfect- the toe has protection and the edge and bite of the sole works great. I was also looking for cushion and I would say the cushion is cloud-like. The reduction in fatigue from long runs is really noticed. The shoe is sturdy, but the comfort is level 10. By far my favorite 10+ miler trail shoe I've ever worn. I have to order another pair as these quickly became my dailies. I work in film production and I have lived in these since I purchased them. And not that I care, but I've gotten more compliments and asks about these shoes! The best- I can't say it enough.
review.name: I'm an Altra fiend, but these are heaven sent!

review.reviewBody: Really comfortable My toes aren't cramped anymore Love them
review.name: First time buyer - love them

review.reviewBody: Really like most of the updates over the Olympus 5, but like a lot of others have said, the heel pillow is placed in a super odd spot. It feels like it's not holding my Achilles in the right spot so it's contributing to heel slip issues. If it was moved up a bit it would hold in the right spot and my foot would locked in. Would also love to see about 2 more inches in the laces! Going to wear these for a few more days to see if the heel pillow breaks in some, but majorly bummed so far. Hopefully the heel settles some and the lock in gets better! If they fit your foot and that pillow hits the right spot, these will be incredible.
review.name: So close to being perfect!

name: Olympus 6 Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: These shorts would do fine for hiking or climbing, but honestly I like them for office work, especially given their wrinkle-free aspect. I got the sepia color and am happy with it.
review.name: Great casual short

review.reviewBody:
I have owned multiple pairs of these shorts for over 7 years now and they are unbeatable. I think the fit may have changed slightly since the migration from Brion to Brion II, but then again I could have just gained weight...although I still have the smaller size and they fit, so either I stretched them out or a change did occur. 
What I love about these shorts is they aren't too stretchy or loose. You want the short to fit you with some movement but not just be holding on with your belt because they stretch so much. These shorts are pretty much wrinkle free and always look great. You can dress them up with a nice Polo and loafers or dress them down with a T-shirt and tennis shoes. I recently picked up the grey-blue color (I believe its new for this year) and really like it. Not Navy, but a medium blue with a hint of grey hence the name. I love that other than the zip fly there are no other zippers on this short. Recently picked up a pair of shorts that were comfortable but they had zip front pockets,.... so uncomfortable, especially if you place your hands in your pocket. The metal button and just overall feel make this short a long term staple in your wardrobe.
review.name: Best all around shorts

name: Brion 9in Short II - Men's

review.reviewBody: My 12 y.o. grandson finds being able to collapse the poles very useful when carpooling with friends. He is very disappointed in the paint quality because it easily chips off. He does not use the hand grips because of the large size and difficulty of use. Thus, he has problems dropping the poles because the tips get stuck. By the way, they do not appear to have a carbon shaft. You should take that off of the description.
review.name: Grandson likes the collapsing feature

review.reviewBody: Poles appear to be well made but online description says carbon shaft in one portion and aluminum in the other.  These poles have aluminum shafts and are a bit expensive for that.  My daughter loves the color so we are keeping them.

hasVariant.name: Neve Strap Crampons + ABS
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Neve Strap Crampons + ABS online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These things were perfect for my last spring splitboarding mission up Shastina in California. They 're lightweight, compact, fit well over a snowboard boot, and provided more than adequate security for traversing and booting up icy slopes in the early hours of a spring ski expedition. Highly recommended. Only thing that could make it better is if they came with a crampon bag.
review.name: Great for Spring Splitboarding!

review.reviewBody: I’ve used these at tuckerman ravine. They fit snuggly and are very adjustable. I don’t like heights so they made me feel much better when climbing the re frozen spring snow.
review.name: Fits snowboard boots

review.reviewBody: Big snow years mean that while the cliffs are melted out, the approaches can by anything but. These fit on my approach shoes and are insurance that I can make it to the base of a climb without risking my neck. Super light weight and easy to fit to stiff approach shoes and hiking boots. A great option when you don't need full mountaineering boots, but you're going to bring an ice axe.
review.name: Great Alpine Insurance

review.reviewBody: I have a pair of the Neve Strap Crampons that I haven't tried yet but they look amazing. The overall quality can be felt with the materials. I can't wait to get them on the mountain and dig into the snow!
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: Very light weight and adjustable. Perfect for putting on approach shoes, ski boots, etc.

I wore these with some sturdy-ish approach shoes ( ankle height) for a mixed carry-over objective. Just needed something for the mostly low angle glacier that had a few steep sections and a tricky moat. I was glad I had them and I was impressed by how stable I felt, given how minimal they are and the footwear I was in. Very comfortable fit and easy to adjust. I didn’t really notice them taking up space or adding weight to my pack for the 5th class sections. I’ll be using these as often as the terrain will let me get away with it. Thanks BD!
review.name: Perfect for a light alpine carry-over

review.reviewBody:
These are great poons, which fits most, if not all boots and stay on when you need them to. They are (obviously) not made for tromping across rock, but the aluminum is quite hard and mine showed little wear after 3 weeks of continuous use, with care on the short stretches of rock that we did encounter.

I also have the alternate version of these, with the steel toe bail. I do not recommend this version unless your boots have a substantial toe extension, which is unlikely with most modern boots. If there is not an adequate toe lip, they will come off frequently (and typically, at the worst of times).
review.name: These are great poons, which

review.reviewBody: Easy to strap to ski boots for spring missions.  Easily strap to semi ridged hiking boots for climbing snow.
review.name: Great all around

review.reviewBody: I'm so sad this product is not being made right now, but I absolutely loved the pair I had! Fit right on my approach shoes securely, felt solid on glacier travel.

name: Neve Strap Crampons + ABS
