hasVariant.name: Professional 14 2 Burner Griddle
hasVariant.description: Buy the Camp Chef Professional 14 2 Burner Griddle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great griddle, better than I expected. I would recommend.
review.name: Great griddle

review.reviewBody: Great quality, quite heavy, perfect fit. Checkout process was easy. Shipping was affordable and quick.
review.name: Great quality

review.reviewBody:
There's not much to say about the griddle, in the end it's a piece of metal that does what it's supposed to do. 
It's easy to clean and maintain, the bacon and other food you cook come out very nicely cooked.
The only reason why it gets 4 stars it's mainly due to the fact that there are parts where it's hotter than others and it might cook things unevenly if you don't know where these are.
Overall, a good purchase that will last for years.
review.name: Great addition to the sidekick

review.reviewBody: This griddle cracked down the middle first time warming up to season on medium heat.
review.name: Piece of crap!!!
comment:
Hi Unhappy Customer,

We are very sorry for your inconvenience. Please contact support@campchef.com and we would love to make things right.

review.reviewBody: Bought the new style sidekick and really do not like it at all burnt everything cannot control temp so got griddle to use on sidekick and it is a little better able to control heat but not near as good as old sidekick.
review.name: Griddle

review.reviewBody: Used the griddle for the first time this weekend.  Very happy once I figured out the heat distribution from the 2 burner Camp Chef.  Paid attention to seasoning it before use and it paid off as it cleaned up good!
review.name: Works great!

review.reviewBody: Used on dozens of camping trips over 7+ years and honestly, I could easily feed 6-8 people with this thing. As a person who loves to camp and cook, my flat top griddle paired with a wok is all I need to cook just about everything. Heavy duty, easy to clean, even heat, and 10/10. Wish I had one in my kitchen!
review.name: Excellent piece of iron!

review.reviewBody: This is an indispensable tool for cooking for many. I used this to cook gyros for 200 folks with great success.  Heat dispersed well, and it stays hot for radiant heat and continuity. It gets hot so plan to sweat! If you cooking. A grease trap is offered as an accessory but should be standard. Grease will flow out and all over the leg of the stove/floor. Placed a cup in the provided hanging holder but the cup melted quickly. Also, a carrying bag should be standard.
review.name: Don’t hesitate to add this to your Kit.

review.reviewBody: Works great, easy to use and clean up fairly easy.
review.name: Love the griddle

review.reviewBody: The two burner griddle for the explorer fits well, heats nicely, but cannot be scraped to clean it. The metal is not the same as a restaurant flattop griddle. That being said, the grease can be moved into the grease catcher on the front corner of the griddle wiped with a good cloth after the griddle cools and is ready for a bit of oil and more cooking!! As a portable griddle and pack along two burner stove, you just cannot beat the convenience or the price!!!
review.name: Cooks well but no scraping to clean

name: Professional 14 2 Burner Griddle

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Tall Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Awesome construction, warm, and all day comfortable!
review.name: Awesome!

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Tall Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I live in the mountains and was looking for a comfortable cold weather hiking boot and these are it! I even wear them on no cold or snowy days because they are super comfortable and versatile.
review.name: Love these boots!

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Tall Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I am a farmers market manager and these are my go to boots! The comfort and stability I need for being on my feet for long periods is great. Also works well for the colder temps and wet grass I have to navigate n the market space. I additionally love the look of the boot. Work boot with style! :)
review.name: Farmers Market Manager says...10/10!

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Tall Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: The reason for the 3 star is the fit, it ran big and the toe points more upward than expected. Otherwise it's warm and comfortable. It's a pretty costly boot, and expected for the size exchange to be easy and quick but it was not. I needed to reach out for that to move along. Barely got use of it for this season as a result. Make sure to get the right size..
review.name: Fine boot but runs big; not really worth the price

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Tall Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love my new boots from Bogs. They are stylish, but still warm and dry. I thought they ran a little large, but I don't mind since I'm usually wearing thicker socks with them. The speed hooks make it so easy to put them on and take them off!
review.name: Quality!

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Tall Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought these for wife before European Christmas trip. Stayed warm with a pair of hiking sock and comfy walking an average of 20k to 26k steps a day. Great buy.
review.name: Great winter boot

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Tall Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I was very excited to get these, but was a little disappointed when I opened them and they didnt look as cool as they did in the picture. The toe is long and triangular and they arent as sturdy as I'd imagined. The leather also scuffs very easily. Lastly the soles arent quite as grippy as they look. However, they are great for wet weather and waterproof.
review.name: Look different in person

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Tall Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These boots are cute and comfy but they sure aren't waterproof. A walk thru a bog proved that in no time. But one can't expect miracles.
review.name: Not waterproof

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Tall Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable - true to size. (I'm a W10) Lots of room in the toe box and a snug heel, so while they're not hiking boots, they are comfortable for winter hiking activity - not just cute "parking lot" boots. Easy on/easy off. It's only snowed once so far so I haven't given them a real winter workout, but they were warm and comfortable and dry. Fingers crossed they're as waterproof as Boggs claims. Very happy with this purchase.
review.name: Happy Feet

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Tall Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these at the beginning of summer, so I have not worn them much. I can say that they are very comfortable, and have a great thick insole that gives a lot of support. The outer tread is pretty gnarly and grippy. I love the style, they are super cute!
review.name: Comfy and Cute!

name: Arcata Urban Leather Tall Boot - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Castelli Free Tri 2 Sleeveless Top - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I don't do Tris, but bought this Tri top as sort-of a summer jersey. The summer heat here in North Texas is BRUTAL, and every bit of cooling available is welcomed; this top should be quite breathable, and also useful as a base layer in cooler weather. Seems to be the usual top-quality Castelli construction.
A word on sizing: I have a lot of Castelli items...I'm 5'11.5" 34" chest, 32-33" waist, slender in upper body; most Castelli jerseys in size M fit me just fine, a snug "race" fit. Castelli's stuff seems to run generally on the small side - I'd ordered this item from a retailer in Europe in size M, but was too small, had to return; this size L from Comp. Cyclist fits me just fine.
review.name: Perfect For Our Extremely Hot Summers!

name: Free Tri 2 Sleeveless Top - Men's

description: Buy the Shimano MW5 Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: MW5 Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Shimano MW5 Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I've put around 500 miles on these shoes in what is admittedly a somewhat warm winter here in southern new england.  

My feet tend to run pretty cold so I augment the insulation with some chemical toe warmers, and my feet have been great all winter with these.  Riding in temps running from upper 20s to the mid 50s these have kept my feet warm and toasty.  

The overlapping flap on the top of the shoe does a really good job of keeping out the mud and road spray.
review.name: Good fit, pretty warm

review.reviewBody: I have not had a chance to put these to the winter weather test since it's just cooling off here, but the fit and comfort are great so far. The soles feel great on the pedals (Saint) and interface (best way to describe clicking in and out? ha ha) as smoothly as you'd expect with a Shimano combo. Feel as good on the bike as when hiking the bike. We will see what the winter weather bring, but good so far.
review.name: Fit and comfort great so far

name: MW5 Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Fantastic all-mountain play ski. Can rip turns and play in the park all day, everyday.
review.name: Bent 90 Rips

review.reviewBody: I am a multiple year X Games athlete and skied on a different brand of ski back in the day.  I now buy my skis and I only buy the Bent line. I buy the bent 90 for my kid  (15 yrs old) who now competes in USASA slope and Rail events, Futures events and the occasional bigmountain freeride event. The Bent skis are the only line of skis that will hold up to the abuse he puts them through. the tip will not delaminate and the edges will hold up. It is also one of the lightest skis on the market.  I still don't understand why every athlete ( that is not sponsored ) doesn't buy this ski.
review.name: best built ski on the market

review.reviewBody: C’est comme de la magie, le ski nous donnent des émotions et des sensations incroyables et cela peut importe la vitesse et le type de neige…. Bonus… il est super beau …Good job !
review.name: Magique

review.reviewBody: These are exactly what I have been looking for. They are more streamlined than Blundstone and not as clunky. However, they run big. I wear an 8 in almost everything, 8.5 in New Balance & Saucony running shoes, 8.5 in my Keen hiking boots but everything else always an 8. I ordered an 8 and will have to send back because I need a 7.5. They insole feels amazing. I just wore them around the house for a little bit to make sure that I wanted to send them back. So sad that I have to reorder because I want to wear them now.
review.name: Love, Love, Love

description: Buy the Karakoram PRIME Interface 2.0 Splitboard Kit online or shop all Snowboard from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: PRIME Interface 2.0 Splitboard Kit
hasVariant.description: Buy the Karakoram PRIME Interface 2.0 Splitboard Kit online or shop all Snowboard from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Going on 3 seasons with the prime 2.0 interface without a single hiccup. Incredible system, the 4 point locking system makes my split feel solid - I literally can't feel a difference between my split and my resort board. The polymer does a great job preventing ice buildup, transitions have never been a problem for me even in cold/wet conditions. The touring brackets are just as bomber, the toe locks in solid and the dualspeed risers are a lifesaver for hiking the steeps of the wasatch. Kudos to the engineers at karakoram for this work of art!

*To the <5 star reviews: DO YOUR RESEARCH. The product description clearly states that Connect bindings need tour pin adapters in order to run this interface.
review.name: Bombproof!

review.reviewBody: High Quality Engineered parts it seems.  They are very much engineers who are good at making parts/design.  Bad at marketing, and showing clear, intuitive instructions.  They don't include the $40 bars that you need to mount on the front of the bindings.  Make sure you get these separately on the Karakoram website.  Pretty poor kit, that doesn't include everything you need.
review.name: You need a part not included to Tour

name: PRIME Interface 2.0 Splitboard Kit

review.reviewBody: Works as expected - very easy to use and while I use it as a back up for another Ascender - using them for top rope soling, I'm going to grab another and keep the system consistent. As I said - it works really well and is very easy to set up. Thanks for a great product!
review.name: Works as Advertised

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Trail Bike Henley - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I bought this thinking it was just like the other capiliene shirts I’ve bought that are Patagonia.
I was so disappointed. This material is much heavier and has a cotton mixture in it and doesn’t breathe like the other capiliene shirts I have gotten that are Patagonia. It doesn’t drape as nicely and just like wearing a bag.  So if you’re used to the nice thin capiliene shirts that I was accustomed from Patagonia don’t buy this. I do not enjoy wearing this shirt at all. It’s much too thick and too much weight and doesn’t breathe. Can’t return it I have worn it to see if I can get used to it for a day but no. I am so saddened that I didn’t stick to the old and familiar and this one cost more also. Thought it would be cute but boy was I wrong!
review.name: Henley Patagonia Top

hasVariant.name: Boa Eco Climbing Rope - 9.8mm
hasVariant.description: Buy the Edelrid Boa Eco Climbing Rope - 9.8mm online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Bought this to upgrade my old rope before a recent trip. Love it! Decent amount of stretch and doesn’t hockle up when flaking or storing. The 60m is sufficient for pretty much everything. And love the utilization of recycled materials. Would definitely recommend this rope.
review.name: Great rope

review.reviewBody: I love this thing. I've used and abused it for many, many pitches of sharp New England granite and, other than a little fuzziness, it's going as strong as ever. The recycled sheath is a great idea and looks great (in my opinion), plus it doesn't get super dirty. That it's cheap is an added benefit. Basically, I never think about it, which is exactly what I want from a rope. Highly recommended.
review.name: Perfect Do-Everything Rope

review.reviewBody: Great work horse rope! No kinks, no twists straight out of the package. Still holding strong after months of abuse. Probably one of the best ropes I've used for the low price.
review.name: Great All-Arounder

name: Boa Eco Climbing Rope - 9.8mm

description: Buy the Union Charger Splitboard Binding - 2024 online or shop all Snowboard from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Charger Splitboard Binding - 2024
hasVariant.description: Buy the Union Charger Splitboard Binding - 2024 online or shop all Snowboard from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I had the union expeditions and those worked great, but they made these even better and fixed everything that wasn’t perfect with those in this new generation. Kudos to Union for listening to feedback and making those changes. These bindings are quick, easy, and rock solid so far.
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: This was the first time I tried a pin less split board binding.  I love it.  I wasn’t sure if the difference would be worth the reinvestment from my traditional Explorer bindings.   I’m really happy with how easy the Charger is to operate.  Blown away actually.  Just like  you’d expect from Union, they ride great downhill when on decent.   I keep these on my split set up and have now picked up a pair of Union Rovers for my set of Explorers to keep them in the mix.
review.name: Charger!

name: Charger Splitboard Binding - 2024

hasVariant.description: Buy the Muc-Off eBike Wet Chain Lube online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I use this lube across my entire quiver of bikes.  It's light--I don't get a bunch of grime stuck to my drivetrain.  It's effective.  And It smells lovely to boot.  Your chain does get dry quickly in super dusty conditions so be prepared to reapply regularly.  But it's not really a big deal if you're doing a good job of maintaining anyway.  I just find I have to use it more often than some other lubes.  That said, this is one of my favorites to use.
review.name: Great Light Lube

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Doesnt grime up like wd40. Isn't quick to rust like when theres no protection. Operates smooth enough.
review.name: It works

name: eBike Wet Chain Lube

review.reviewBody: Love these keychains. The colors are beautiful and they are nice and lightweight. I carry two-one has my car key and the other holds house keys. Easy to find in my bag with the colors. Highly recommend
review.name: Colorful and so useful

review.reviewBody: I bought the rainbow key ring first, loved the feel and the colours. I ordered a sky blue one which does not look like the colour on the website. Much duller. And when i was in the store on Queen West I noticed that all the other colours were dull as well. If you like bright colours like UN blue, stick with the rainbow key ring ! Otherwise great value.
review.name: Great material, very sturdy. Colours do not match website colours at all

review.reviewBody: This keychain is petite, It is exactly what I needed for my key ring. I have two bulky car key fobs gym key fob, and a house key attached to this key ring. Though the keychain is petite, the material and stitching is of quality. I am pleased with my purchase, and plan to order this key ring in the red color as well for the holiday season.
review.name: Petite keychain

review.reviewBody: It's the on the smaller side of a keychain but that's what makes it so easy to carry! It can fit perfectly in pockets and purses allowing you to carry it with you at all times, not to mention that its look is appealing.
review.name: Not invasive but lovely Keychain

review.reviewBody: This is the best key ring that I have ever had.  I have been using the Kanken Keying for over 6 months now and it still looks brand new.  It is super durable and doesn't get scuffed or scratched.  The bright color (acorn) makes it easier to find my keys when I am leaving home, but I also link my work keys to that keyring specifically to be able to find them quicker amongst my other keys.
review.name: Finding your keys, made easy

name: Kanken Keyring

review.reviewBody: I brought one pair of Halle 2 women’s jogger 2 months ago from Backcountry, and only had worn it several times, the material at the back of the pants has been pilling really badly that they’re not wearable anymore.
review.name: Bad quality

review.reviewBody: Was really disappointed that these pants didn't hold up while hiking, ripped right through after only a few wears and brushing against some rocks. They were really comfortable initially but I have way cheaper pants that have held up better.
review.name: Ripped after 3 wears

review.reviewBody: I’m loving these hiking pants. Super comfy and great pockets. They don’t stretch out as the day goes on and my range of motion is great.
review.name: So comfy
